reviews.review_title: This is the wonderful Epic film.
reviews.content: It is such a beautiful story. In Tamil version of music is so fantastic. Mind blowing songs. BGM Is awesome. See this movie. The narration of the story moves from 1985 to 1965. The way of narration is so good. Actors like Dulkar, Mrunal , Rasmiksha, and Gvm, Prakash Raj, and other actors done their job very fantastically . The ending of this movie so sadden. Because Ram will be killed by Pakistani Army without giving any mercy . It was the so sadden part of this story . We looking forward this movie part 2 version. It's so beautiful. Lots of love to entire team. From Villupuram, Tamil Nadu by Vivek .

reviews.review_title: FEEL GOOD MOVIE...WORTHY TO WATCH IN THEATRE
reviews.content: Lead pair did their job perfectly and it's a beautiful love story based on 60's and 70's time period. Visuals are at best. Overall I love this movie. The Narrative way of SethaRamam is too good. Best love story in recent times. I love the first half compared to second half.

We people deserve to watch these kind of movies at least once or twice in a year. The genre might vary but the strong story line and the impeccable acting by the actors and actresses deserve a full rating. Not only the acting but the writing deserves more respect. We need such writers who could actually able to bring the very best to the table. The emotions involved, the thought process behind making the whole part, the actors chosen to do specific task, the revealing of the secrets behind each scene, the costume, and the dialogues have essence to captivate your mind and soul throughout the movie. The most important part would be the intriguing thoughts popping up like what is going to happen next.

reviews.review_title: Sita Ramam - Princess falls in love with a Martyr
reviews.content: In the era of fake love stories that Bollywood offers, getting to see such a well versed brilliant love story is a treat to the heart. Such love stories as in Brahmastra are totally out of sense. With such a brilliant star cast this movie just grabbed my soul.The cinematography and direction is top notch.The way this movie starts makes you feel that it's just like a usual army related movie but the story that twines both a love story and the duty of a Soldier is remarkable. The purity of love is portrayed very well in this movie.The songs are very beautiful and suits perfectly on all the love scenes. There is no speks of nudity or intimate scenes still it makes the chemistry between the two lovers evident.

This is my first time, I am doing review of any movie before this I just thought but never did efforts or may be forgot but this time I can't stop myself to write a review, "Sita rammam " a love story of two birds.. 😍. And all the actors did great job.I don't know what to say but just amazing
I loved it.All scenes were perfect, all songs are great and this boy ram just took my heart . He is a great actor and I'm sure his time is coming.., I saw him in CHUP movie also.., there he played a psycho role and yeah it was perfect. I am saying too much about him because we know both actresses are great obviously...
Thank you for this fab. Love story ❤

reviews.review_title: A film which is worth to watch
reviews.content: One of the best film I have seen in 2022 so far. Everything in this film is outstanding like screenplay, story writing, cinematography and acting of the all the actors. Dulquer Salmaan and Mrunal Thakur have nailed their role of Ram of sita. When the Ram name come in front of us we see the man with idol, character, obedient to law, ready to sacrifice his life for the welfare of others that is what has shown in this film and this is same with the Sita a woman who loves Ram so compassionately that Ram is everything for her. These character building credit must go to the writer of the film. Songs and background music are pleased to hear. First half of the movie is kind of comedy,some romance and other half is full of emotions. There are a lot of suspense points which one can guess while watching the film. Finally, one last thing everyone should watch this film with family or with your loved ones...

reviews.review_title: Superb story with very good acting from all the actors.
reviews.content: Acting was very good from all 3 major actors specially Salman. And the story was very heart touching. The screenplay was good. U may find it littlebit boring in the first half but it wont let u get up in the second half. There r lots of twist n turns used. Direction was very good. It really takes u back to the 60's and 80's. Rashmika has also done superb acting and mrunal thakur just proved that she is a beauty with sheer acting. Real emotions were used. But at the end of the day it was salman the showstopper. Beautiful acting by him. Just like he is living the real character. And played the role like a real Ram.

Awesome story, screenplay, direction it's a perfect piece of story telling.It's Not Just A Love Story it's more Beyond story of Love Story.Awesome Story telling Hats Off to writer/director.This is a family movie, beautiful love story with comedy, suspense, lots of twist & turns.

reviews.review_title: Beautiful luv story ever watched in recent times.
reviews.content: Beautiful luv story ever watched in recent times. Great performances by Mrunal as Sita and Dulquer as Ram. The direction and screen play was amazing.music and songs are the soul of the story.Thanks to Vijayanthi movies in encouraging such a movie,it's a visual treat to watch such a beautiful classic movie. I loved it so much that I had to write my first review for a movie ever.I liked it so much that I watched it 10 times in a week and listening to the music daily. Thanks to Hanu sir and crew for a wonderful epic movie.Finally being a man I need to say that I have fallen in Luv with Sita's character, beautifully portrayed.

What a masterpiece!Hats off!!I am out of words to describe such a beautiful display of pure cinema. Always been a big fan of dulqueer salman and his movies never turns me down. Credit to director hanu and rajkumar for creating such a lively and soul touching cinema in this era of remakes.The storytelling holds you throughout the movie, not even for a moment if felt to fast forward it. The cinematography has been brilliant, it needs to win awards for appreciations, the least that could be done so.Though I watched it telgu with subtitles i felt so connected despite the language I am not versed with.Please keep making amazing cinema like these Mr. Hanu, Dulqueer.!.

reviews.review_title: Most genuine performance by the Artists.
reviews.content: The class of movie touched my heart. A very interesting story which will not let you lift your eyes till the end.Showcasing the life of a Indian Army soldier and a Princess, literally a different type of story you would have ever seen. Anyone who knows the sacrifice of soldiers for our country can relate to the story strongly thats the reason I had tears after a long time. Hatsoff to all the soldiers who chose to never came back for something big than themselves for them. As an Army Doctor aspirant I would definitely remember the movie for my further life.Just felt that "BE READY FOR LOSING THAT WHICH YOU NEVER WANT TO".Hail Mother India !

reviews.review_title: A fun time movie marred with several inconsistency
reviews.content: The story is easy to digest but it is trying to do too many different things at once. The plot is marred in inconsistency. With presence of occassional overdramatisation. Bad use of CG. The film could have been easily trimmed down to 2 hours. Not able to correctly potray the time period it is shown. Trying to stay away from commercial plot holes but still falling into it. Only through correctly potraying the time period can we do justice to the film and the plot The film is riddled with mistake. But I will still stay its worth the watch for the chemistry between the main characters.............................................

reviews.review_title: Dulquer Salman Future of Indian Cinema
reviews.content: Please rate this movie 10/10 .The story of the movie is simple but its screenplay is in one word extraordinary. Whoever wrote the story is a genius. After a long time I saw such a good entertaining movie. Superb screenplay and very romantic emotional masterpiece movie.

A movie to be must watched in the language you understand. A great direction, good acting and what a great bgm to take you deep into the movie. A love story which take you to a different era and make you understand why and how communication through letters can bring changes in human life. Love story started as a surprise and stayed alive forever. Dq, Mrunal did some great acting and ending of the movie may bring some goosebumps as well as tears but it is worth as per the closure given to a apt love story. Worth watching in theater as bgm will bring out your emotional and soothing feeling at many occasions.

reviews.review_title: The best love story I have ever seen on screen!
reviews.content: This is the first time I'm writing a review after a very very long period.I was sure I would never be touched by any new era romance movies.I actually stopped watching romance movies as they just don't make those good anymore - no feelings, no emotions, just lust and dirty jokes.Sita Ramam is totally different.It has that touch of the Golden Classics.Not only in Indian cinema, but globally.Everything in this movie has a touch of an art.Such a poetic love story!Must be seen by everyone!Such exceptions happen once in a decade.Dont miss it, this one is truly a masterpiece.The story of Sita and Ram will stay with you forever, I promise.

Will be remembered forever.Dont miss it on theatres. Its a family must watch. A clean and poetic romantic drama. Just go for it!

Posting publicly.Amazing unbeatable unspeachable lovely movieAfter ages, I have witnessed a movie that may be compared to cult classics like Roja. Director Hanu Raghavapudi has put a stupendous effort into making this poetic romantic tale with breathtaking visuals captured by cinematographer PS Vinod sir. Every scene was nothing short of a painting with such aesthetic the production house Vyjayanthi movies did & hats off to you guys! Another important aspect has been the music & BGM by Vishal Chandrasekhar, what a classic feel from the bygone era! As came to know from his video, all the traditional instruments only were used for composing the songs and it was creating such n impact suiting to the 1960-1980 kind of feel. Choreography by Brinda master was superb.Coming to characters, DQ as Lt. Ram played so effortlessly with his boyish charm, blushing face in love scenes & most importantly dubbed in his own voice! Mrunal Thakur as SitaMahalakshmi urf Noorjahan just lit the screen every time they appeared together! Dream debut of Mrunal down south & must say that YOU HAVE ARRIVED! You are going to stay here for long. What a chemistry between Ram & Sita and I was just sucked into the world of Ram garu & Sita garu and the journey further was nothing short of a spectacle!And the rebellious #Afreen (Rashmika) through whom the whole story unfolds did a completely different role and your combo with #Balaji (Tarun Bhacker) gave many giggles as well. Fantastic job by both of you! Appreciate Sumanth garu for his Vishnu Sharma having grey shades but he did a tremendous role as well. As a viewer, I felt angry upon you & that's just bcoz of your depiction of the character. Thank you Vennela Kishore for "Durjoy" & those comedy.I must say that every character was aptly chosen whether it's GVM as major Selvan or Sachin Khedekar as Major Tariq, PrakashRaj, Rohini, Shatru, Murali Sharma, Sunil, Rahul Ravindran, etc. A special appreciation for Chinmayi Sripada for the beautiful dubbing she did for #Sita's character done by Mrunal.Though it's 2 days since I watched the movie, still unable to come out of it & there is still an urge to watch it again! Such is the addiction of #sitarmam Thanks to Hanu sir for reminiscing the world of letters & the strong bonds of love that it used to carry and also proving that epic romantic tales can be told so artistically as well. You rocked man.Wish all the best for the whole team of #SitaRamam to reach more success & accolades in the coming days.Watch it in any language in the nearest cinemas guys if you don't want to miss the magic of #SitaRamam#SitaRamam #SitaRamamMovie # love.

Dulquer Salmaan has pretty much exhausted all the lover-boy tropes and cinematic cliches in his short but substantial filmography, from the college kid finding his way in life in films like "Neelakasham Pachakadal Chuvanna Bhoomi (2013)" to the more worldly, commitment-phobe in "OK Kanmani (2015)" and it has seemed like he is playing the same characters over and over again in recent projects. So it is with much trepidation and lack of any expectation that I heard the announcement of yet another romance drama with the young scion of Mollywood in the lead, that too in Telugu.The man, however, seems to thrive on throwing conventions and expectations to the wind, combining forces with director Hanu Raghavapudi and two charming leading ladies to deliver one of the most gut-wrenching romantic tales of the year, that is sure to tug at your heartstrings. The period story set against the backdrop of war and terrorism, immaculate production design, colorful costumes, combined with an intrepid lead romantic pairing make "Sita Ramam" the perfect concoction of romance that the box office has been missing for some time.Rashmika Mandanna stars as "Afreen" a cynical, rebellious Pakistani teenager in 1980s London, tasked by her grandfather on his deathbed to return a mysterious letter to an Indian lady who he was never able to locate during his dying days. As the stubborn youngster starts her search for the peculiar person named "Sita Mahalakshmi" (Mrunal Thakur) addressed in the letter, she uncovers more clues that unravel her story as well as that of her dashing lover, "Luitenant Ram" (Dulquer) and their star-crossed romance during the war-ravaged 1960s in Kashmir. While the first half gets sluggish and boring in places, the second half reveals that these initial set-up scenes were crucial to complete the intricate character arcs of our three principal protagonists.Trio of superb performances.

This is a repetition of all the tropes of a Hindu-Muslim love story movie. I have nothing against a well-executed forbidden love story drama, but this one is not it. Many old Bollywood movies have done a far far better job of executing these same tropes.The story of Sita Ramam had so much promise, but it was all wasted by excluding any nuance, depth, or reasonable context. The movie doesn't pick up pace until well into the second half. When it does pick up some pace, it ends abruptly by killing off an important character off-screen (?!!?!??!!). All the characters are flat and one dimensional, but Rashmika Mandana's character (and acting) is a whole new level of annoying. She is given no screen time to redeem herself in the end. The character starts out with such an extreme entitled personality, that even stronger story/character arc would have barely made any impact. The only saving grace for the movie is that the lead pair makes for a very pleasant couple.I have an increased appreciation for Veer Zaara after watching this overrated movie. I am not a huge fan of Shahrukh Khan or Bollywood either. But, everything that is wrong with Sita Ramam has been done far better in many movies before. It is disheartening to see so much hype for a subpar movie like Sita Ramam, when a true masterpiece like Veer Zaara went underappreciated.

reviews.review_title: A story that will make you feel emotional
reviews.content: Director Hanu Raghavapudi's Sita Ramam is a lot more than just a love story. The story, screenplay and dialogues by Hanu, Raj Kumar Kandamudi and Jay Krishna ride on the idea that humanity matters more than war, boundaries and religion. The idea is ever relevant especially in times when discussions of 'them' and 'us' threaten to take over the discourse all around us.Sita Ramam unravels the mystery surrounding its title characters, Sita Mahalakshmi (Mrunal Thakur's debut in Telugu cinema) and Lt Ram (Dulquer Salmaan) through two timelines - 1964 and 1984. Afreen (Rashmika Mandanna), a Pakistan-origin student arrives in India from London, when she is tasked with tracing Sita to hand over a 20-year-letter written to her by Ram. She takes the help of her college senior Balaji (Tharun Bhascker), who is now in Hyderabad.With Sita Ramam, Hanu manages to deliver a story that's moving and a film that's visually aesthetic and pleasing. Go watch this one if you're looking for a breather among all the mass masala.The 1960s are presented like a dream. Posted on the borders of Kashmir on the snowy terrains is Lt Ram. His fellow soldiers are his world; there is a dear friend (played by Shatru), a jealous officer (Sumanth as Brigadier Vishnu Sharma) and a commanding officer Major Selvan (Gautham Menon). An All India Radio journalist (Rohini Molleti) terms Ram a lone ranger and requests listeners to write to him. Letters pour in, Including one from Sita who chides Ram for forgetting that he has a wife back home and that he isn't an orphan.

reviews.review_title: One Of the Most beautiful Love Stories Ever Made
reviews.content: I am not exaggerating. This movie will be remembered as one of the most beautiful Love Stories ever made in India. Hats Off to the Director for crafting this movie brilliantly. Screenplay and Dialogues are top notch. Special kudos to the Music Director for soulful songs and BGM. Last but not the least, kudos to the lead actors for their brilliant performance. All the characters of the movie are very well linked to the story. I dont remember seeing such a well designed story including the minute details of each scene. Some movies will leave their mark in audience hearts / minds after leaving the theatre. This is one such movie. You will surely regret if you miss it. Its an EPIC CLASSIC !!
